thread.title: Flybe passenger tweets 'oh s**t' after 'engine fails' mid flight forcing plane to make emergency landing
thread.title_full: Flybe passenger tweets 'oh s**t' after 'engine fails' mid flight forcing plane to make emergency landing

author: Anthony Bond
title: Flybe passenger tweets 'oh s**t' after 'engine fails' mid flight forcing plane to make emergency landing
text:
News Flybe passenger tweets 'oh s**t' after 'engine fails' mid flight forcing plane to make emergency landing A passenger on the plane - travelling from Glasgow to Birmingham - tweeted a picture of one of the engines saying it had stopped working Share By Anthony Bond Rachel Bishop 11:13, 23 FEB 2017 Passenger John MacInnes tweeted a picture of the plane's engine (Photo: John A MacInnesâ€@pressscotland) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A Flybe passenger plane was forced to make an emergency landing after claims one of its engine’s failed mid-flight. 
A passenger on the plane - travelling from Glasgow to Birmingham - tweeted a picture of one of the engines saying it had stopped working. 
Journalist John MacInnes wrote: “Oh s**t. Number one engine has failed and we’re returning to Glasgow for an emergency landing!” 
Minutes later he shared footage of the plane just after it landed on the runaway. 
Sharing the video, he wrote: "Down safe n' sound thanks to the professionalism of our pilots." 
A number of flashing fire engines and police cars could be seen on the runway. Read More 
After the plane landed, John tweeted a picture of the two Flybe pilots that brought the plane safely back to the ground. 
He wrote next to the image: "Two amazing pilots." 
It is understood all passengers were unharmed in the incident. 
Mirror Online has contacted Flybe for comment. Like us on Facebook
